attributes.comment:
My two cent..

I believe that increase are necessary when justified. And maybe in this case it is.
But it's too large of an increase at one time. The only way an increase this lager
could be justified is if the current crappy system that breaks up and ruins families,
economically, financially, and socially is if it was fixed so that applicants who go
thru the system and file all the proper paperwork can have their Green Card within
12 months from beginning to end.

I am personally very discourage by the whole system right now after getting my I-
140 approved then was told I would have to wait for a Visa from the State
Department to be available before I can file my I-485 for myself and the rest of my
family who've been here with me in the U.S. for over three years and cannot work.
This system has made them useless. Three years! And with my priority date of
February 7, 2006 and the State Department Visa status showing August 1 2002 it
seem to me as if they, as well as I might have to wait a few more years before we
can all apply to change our status. THIS IS FRUSTRATING..And not to mention
very costly since I've employed an immigration lawyer to help me become a Lawful
Permanent Residence.

If Immigration want to increase the fee for applications then do something to
reduce the time and money it's costing, honest, law abiding people like me that
it's suffocating along with the other members of my family. Why is there a wait for
Visa from the State Department. Make is so that as soon as an individual goes
thru the system legally and gets an approval at each state there's that they are
not going to waiting for this and that. Like a priority dates. We all want to go on
living and this wait is not enabling us to move forward and is the cause of much
stress and anxiety.

RAISE THE FEES GRADUALLY, BUT FIX THE SYSTEM AND STOP WAISTING
TIME AND RUINING FAMILIES.

Sincerely Yours

Steve Dickenson
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Steve Dickenson
